item.title: Great Podcasts I Recommend
item.author: Brian Su
item.description:
For the past two summers, I've been driving a lot. This summer, I spend at least 40 minutes in my car and about 2 hours on a bus to work each workday. That's a lot of time to kill! What I can't stand are the songs they play on the radio - 94.9, 97.3, 99.7, 101.3, 101.7. They are repetitive and trashy, maybe except Taylor Swift, whom I usually enjoy listening to. As I spend more time on the road, I have realized that podcasts are the way to go for long commutes. Depending on your selection, they can be interesting, educational, and make you feel like you've learned something useful during the day. Here are some my recommendations, which I'll continually update over time as I discover more:

  1. Planet Money

    I started listening to Planet Money in high school. The podcast focuses on local and global topics, such as like hiding a million dollars in plain sight, countries selling citizenship, and ticket scalping. They even setup an offshore company to understand how it works. Each episode is an investigation into the topic, with a several interviews with experts and ordinary people and is well narrated. I've learned a lot from just listening to these podcasts. Here are some of my recommendations:

    • What happens when a country, Argentina, refuses to pay its debts?
    • How the government setup a fake bank to launder drug money and uncover the drug cartel?
    • How does a scam work and who gets scammed?
    • Getting caught insider trading.

  2. Startup
  3. Talking Machines
  4. Partially Derivative
  5. Serial
  6. Reply All
